 708+ CA1F              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 709+ CA1F              ;TransposeVertex:
 710+ CA1F              ;                      [ sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x ]   [ x ]
 711+ CA1F              ;  projected [x y z] = [ sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y ] . [ y ]
 712+ CA1F              ;                      [ sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z ]   [ z ]
 713+ CA1F              ; VectorToVertex:
 714+ CA1F              ;                     [ sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x ]   [ x ]   [ x ]
 715+ CA1F              ;  vector to vertex = [ sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y ] . [ y ] + [ y ]
 716+ CA1F              ;                     [ sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z ]   [ z ]   [ z ]
 717+ CA1F              ;INPUTS:    bhl = dividend  cde = divisor where b and c are sign bytes
 718+ CA1F              ;OUTPUTS:   cahl = quotient cde = divisor
 719+ CA1F              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 720+ CA1F                                      ;include "./ModelRender/EraseOldLines-EE51.asm"
 721+ CA1F               ; OBSOLETE                       include "./ModelRender/TrimToScreenGrad-LL118.asm"
 722+ CA1F                                      include "./ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm"
# file opened: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
   1++CA1F              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   2++CA1F
   3++CA1F 00           clipDx                  DB      0           ; also XX12+2
   4++CA20 00           clipDxHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   5++CA21 00           clipDxHighNonABS        DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   6++CA22 00           clipDy                  DB      0           ; also XX12+4
   7++CA23 00           clipDyHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+5
   8++CA24 00           clipGradient            DB      0
   9++CA25 00           clipDxySign             DB      0
  10++CA26              varX12p3                equ     clipDxySign
  11++CA26 00           clipXGTY                DB      0
  12++CA27 00           clipFlags               DB      0
  13++CA28 00           SWAP                    DB      0
  14++CA29 00 00        varYX                   DW      0
  15++CA2B              ;varRegX                 DB      0
  16++CA2B              ;varXX12p2               DB      0
  17++CA2B 00           clipXX13                 DB      0
  18++CA2C 00           Gradient                DB      0
  19++CA2D              ; for start and end y. bit7 of lower determines its not been setup yet
  20++CA2D
  21++CA2D              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  22++CA2D                      IFNDEF       CLIPVersion3
  23++CA2D ED 4B A8 C0  ClipLine:               ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)          ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
  24++CA31 DD 2A AC C0                          ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)          ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
  25++CA35 2A A6 C0                             ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)          ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
  26++CA38 ED 5B AA C0                          ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)          ; de - XX15(4,5) X2
  27++CA3C AF                                   xor     a
  28++CA3D 32 28 CA                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; SWAP = 0
  29++CA40 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; A = X2Hi
  30++CA41 FD 26 BF     .LL147:                 ld      iyh,$BF                     ; we need to be 191 as its 128 + another bit set from 0 to 6, we are using iyh as regX (128 will actually do)
  31++CA44 DD B4                                or      ixh                         ; if (X2Hi L-OR Y2 Hi <> 0) goto LL107             -- X2Y2 off screen
  32++CA46 20 0A                                jr      nz, .LL107
  33++CA48 DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  34++CA4A ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; if screen hight < y2 lo, i.e y2 lo >127 goto LL107,
  35++CA4D 20 03                                jr      nz,.LL107
  36++CA4F FD 26 00                             ld      iyh, 0                      ; else iyh = regX = 0                                                                        -- X2Y2 on screen
  37++CA52              ; XX13 = regX (i.e. iyh)      ( if XX13 = XX13 is 191 if (x2, y2) is off-screen else 0) we bin XX13 as not needed
  38++CA52              ; so XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen,  XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lo is off the bottom of the screen
  39++CA52 FD 7C        .LL107                  ld      a,iyh
  40++CA54 32 2B CA                             ld      (clipXX13),a                ; debug copy iyh to xx13
  41++CA57 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If (X1 hi L-OR Y1) hi  goto LL83                   -- X1Y1 off screen and maybe X2Y2
  42++CA58 B0                                   or      b                           ;
  43++CA59 20 27                                jr      nz,.LL83                    ;
  44++CA5B 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; or (y1 lo > bottom of screen)
  45++CA5C ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; i.e  screen height < y1)
  46++CA5F 20 21                                jr      nz,.LL83
  47++CA61              ; If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen
  48++CA61 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh = xx13 at this point if  XX13 <> 0 goto LL108                                                        -- X1Y1 on screen, if we flagged X2Y2 off screen goto LL108
  49++CA63 FE 00                                cp      0
  50++CA65 20 15                                jr      nz, .LL108
  51++CA67              ; Finished clipping exit point ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  52++CA67 79           .ClipDone:              ld      a,c                         ; LL146 (Clip Done)               Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
  53++CA68 32 A7 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
  54++CA6B DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  55++CA6D 32 A9 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
  56++CA70 7D                                   ld      a,l
  57++CA71 32 A6 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
  58++CA74 7B                                   ld      a,e
  59++CA75 32 A8 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
  60++CA78                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; carry is clear so valid to plot is in XX15(0to3)
  60++CA78 B7          >                        or a
  61++CA79 C9                                   ret                                 ; 2nd pro different, it swops based on swop flag around here.
  62++CA7A              ; Finished out of bounds exit point -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  63++CA7A              .PointsOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                        ; LL109 (ClipFailed) carry flag set as not visible
  63++CA7A 37          >                        scf
  64++CA7B C9                                   ret
  65++CA7C FD 7C        .LL108:                 ld      a,iyh
  66++CA7E B7                                   or      a
  67++CA7F 1F                                   rra
  68++CA80 FD 67                                ld      iyh,a                       ; (X2Y2 Off Screen)         XX13 = 95 (i.e. divide it by 2)                                                 -- X1Y1 on screen X2Y2 off screen
  69++CA82 FD 7C        .LL83:                  ld      a,iyh                       ; (Line On screen Test)      if XX13 < 128 then only 1 point is on screen so goto LL115                      -- We only need to deal with X2Y2
  70++CA84 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
  71++CA87 28 28                                jr      z, .LL115                   ;
  72++CA89              ;                       Check for X1 and X2 negative
  73++CA89 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  74++CA8A A2                                   and     d
  75++CA8B                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  75++CA8B FA 7A CA    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  76++CA8E              ;                       Check for Y1 and Y2 negative
  77++CA8E 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  78++CA8F DD A4                                and     ixh
  79++CA91                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  79++CA91 FA 7A CA    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  80++CA94              ;                       Check for X1 and X2 both > 255
  81++CA94 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set, jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C  flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
  82++CA95 3D                                   dec     a
  83++CA96 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a                       ; using iyl as XX12+2 var
  84++CA98 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; a = x2 hi
  85++CA99 3D                                   dec     a
  86++CA9A FD B5                                or      iyl                         ; (x2 hi -1 ) or (x1 hi -1)
  87++CA9C                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  87++CA9C F2 7A CA    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
  88++CA9F              ; by here we have eliminated -ve Y1 bounds so can just test for positive high and bit 7 of lo
  89++CA9F DD 7C                                ld      a,ixh
  90++CAA1 3D                                   dec     a
  91++CAA2 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
  92++CAA4 78                                   ld      a,b
  93++CAA5 3D                                   dec     a
  94++CAA6 FD B5                                or      iyl
  95++CAA8                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  95++CAA8 F2 7A CA    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
  96++CAAB 79                                   ld      a,c
  97++CAAC DD A5                                and     ixl
  98++CAAE                                      JumpIfNegative .PointsOutofBounds   ; really if both are > 127
  98++CAAE FA 7A CA    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  99++CAB1              ; Clip line: calulate the line's gradient
 100++CAB1              ; here as an optimisation we make sure X1 is always < X2  later on
 101++CAB1              .LL115:                 ClearCarryFlag
 101++CAB1 B7          >                        or a
 102++CAB2 E5 D5        .CalcDX:                push    hl,,de
 103++CAB4 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; so hl is x2 and de = x1
 104++CAB5 ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 105++CAB7 22 1F CA                             ld      (clipDx),hl
 106++CABA 7C                                   ld      a,h
 107++CABB 32 21 CA                             ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a
 108++CABE              .CalcDy:                ClearCarryFlag
 108++CABE B7          >                        or a
 109++CABF DD E5 E1                             ld      hl,ix
 110++CAC2 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc
 111++CAC4 54 5D                                ld      de,hl           ;;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21
 112++CAC6 22 22 CA                             ld      (clipDy),hl     ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 113++CAC9 7C           .CalcQuadrant:          ld      a,h
 114++CACA 32 23 CA                             ld      (clipDyHigh),a              ; so A = sign of deltay in effect
 115++CACD              ; So we now have delta_x in XX12(3 2), delta_y in XX12(5 4)  where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 116++CACD 21 20 CA                             ld      hl,clipDxHigh
 117++CAD0 AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; now a = sign dx xor sign dy
 118++CAD1 32 A1 7E                             ld      (varS),a                    ; DEBGU putting it in var S too for now
 119++CAD4 32 25 CA                             ld      (clipDxySign),a
 120++CAD7 3A 23 CA     .AbsDy:                 ld      a,(clipDyHigh)
 121++CADA ED 27 80                             test    $80
 122++CADD 28 0E                                jr      z,.LL110                    ; If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 123++CADF ED 5B 22 CA                          ld      de,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 124++CAE3                                      macronegate16de                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 124++CAE3 AF          >					xor 	a
 124++CAE4 93          >                    sub 	e
 124++CAE5 5F          >                    ld 		e,a
 124++CAE6 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 124++CAE7 92          >                    sub 	d
 124++CAE8 57          >                    ld 		d,a
 125++CAE9 ED 53 22 CA                          ld      (clipDy),de                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 126++CAED 2A 1F CA     .LL110:                 ld      hl,(clipDx)
 127++CAF0 3A 20 CA                             ld      a,(clipDxHigh)
 128++CAF3 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; is it a negative X
 129++CAF6 28 06                                jr      z,.LL111                    ; If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 130++CAF8                                      ;ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 131++CAF8                                      macronegate16hl                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 131++CAF8 AF          >					xor 	a
 131++CAF9 95          >					sub 	l
 131++CAFA 6F          >					ld 		l,a
 131++CAFB 9F          >					sbc 	a,a
 131++CAFC 94          >					sub 	h
 131++CAFD 67          >					ld 		h,a
 132++CAFE              .LL111:
 133++CAFE 7C           .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                         ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 134++CAFF B2                                   or      d
 135++CB00 28 0A                                jr      z,.CalculateDelta
 136++CB02                                      ShiftDERight1
 136++CB02 CB 3A       >			   srl d
 136++CB04 CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 137++CB06                                      ShiftHLRight1
 137++CB06 CB 3C       >			   srl h
 137++CB08 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 138++CB0A 18 F2                                jr      .ScaleLoop                  ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been negative
 139++CB0C              .CalculateDelta:
 140++CB0C              ; By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero We know that h and d are both = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ
 141++CB0C AF           .LL113:                 xor     a
 142++CB0D 32 BB 7E                             ld      (varT),a                    ; t = 0
 143++CB10 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 144++CB11                                      JumpIfALTNusng  e, .LL114           ;
 144++CB11 BB          >                        cp      e
 144++CB12 DA 22 CB    >                        jp		c, .LL114
 145++CB15              ; Here Dx >= Dy sp calculate Delta Y / delta X
 146++CB15 32 9F 7E     .DxGTEDy:               ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = delta_x_lo
 147++CB18 57                                   ld      d,a                         ; d = also Q for calc
 148++CB19 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; Set A = delta_y_lo
 149++CB1A CD 1D 94                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate:  R (actually a reg) = 256 * A / Q   = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 150++CB1D 32 A0 7E                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 151++CB20 18 10                                jr      .LL116                      ; Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 152++CB22              ; Here Delta Y > Delta X so calulate delta X / delta Y
 153++CB22 7B           .LL114:                 ld      a,e                         ; Set Q = delta_y_lo
 154++CB23 57                                   ld      d,a
 155++CB24 32 9F 7E                             ld      (varQ),a
 156++CB27 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; Set A = delta_x_lo
 157++CB28 CD 1D 94                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q  = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 158++CB2B 32 A0 7E                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 159++CB2E 21 BB 7E                             ld      hl,varT                     ; T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF
 160++CB31 35                                   dec     (hl)
 161++CB32 D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 162++CB33 E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 163++CB34 3A A0 7E                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 164++CB37 32 24 CA                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 165++CB3A FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 166++CB3C 3A A1 7E                             ld      a,(varS)
 167++CB3F 32 25 CA                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 168++CB42                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 169++CB42 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 170++CB44 FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 171++CB46 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 172++CB48 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 173++CB4B 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 174++CB4D              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 175++CB4D CD 74 CB     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 176++CB50 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 177++CB52 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 178++CB55 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 179++CB57              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 180++CB57 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 181++CB58 B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 182++CB59 C2 7A CA                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 183++CB5C B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 184++CB5D FA 7A CA                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 185++CB60              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 186++CB60              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 187++CB60 EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 188++CB61 DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 189++CB63 C5                                   push    bc
 190++CB64 DD E1                                pop     ix
 191++CB66 C1                                   pop     bc
 192++CB67 CD 74 CB                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 193++CB6A 3A 28 CA                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 194++CB6D 3D                                   dec     a
 195++CB6E 32 28 CA                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 196++CB71 C3 67 CA     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 197++CB74              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 198++CB74              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 199++CB74 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 200++CB75 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 201++CB78 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 202++CB7A 32 A1 7E     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 203++CB7D E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 204++CB80 CD F6 CB                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 205++CB83                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 206++CB83                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 207++CB83 C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 208++CB86 2A 29 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 209++CB89 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 210++CB8A 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 211++CB8C 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 212++CB8F 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 213++CB91 FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 214++CB93 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 215++CB95 3D                                   dec     a
 216++CB96 32 A1 7E                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 217++CB99 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 218++CB9C CD F6 CB                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 219++CB9F                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 220++CB9F                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 221++CB9F C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 222++CBA2 2A 29 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 223++CBA5 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 224++CBA6 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 225++CBA8 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 226++CBAB              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 227++CBAB 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 228++CBAC ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 229++CBAF 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 230++CBB1 32 A1 7E                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 231++CBB4 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 232++CBB5 32 A0 7E                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 233++CBB8 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 234++CBBB CD 57 CC                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 235++CBBE                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 236++CBBE                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 237++CBBE C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 238++CBC1 D5                                   push    de
 239++CBC2 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 240++CBC3 2A 29 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 241++CBC6 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 242++CBC7 D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 243++CBC8 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 244++CBCB 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 245++CBCC E6 80                                and     $80
 246++CBCE B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 247++CBCF C8                                   ret     z
 248++CBD0 E5                                   push    hl
 249++CBD1 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 250++CBD3 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 251++CBD6 B7                                   or      a
 252++CBD7 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 253++CBD9 22 A0 7E                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 254++CBDC 7C                                   ld      a,h
 255++CBDD E1                                   pop     hl
 256++CBDE ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 257++CBE1 C0                                   ret     nz
 258++CBE2              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 259++CBE2 E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 260++CBE5 CD 57 CC                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 261++CBE8                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 262++CBE8                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 263++CBE8 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 264++CBEB D5                                   push    de
 265++CBEC EB                                   ex      hl,de
 266++CBED 2A 29 CA                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 267++CBF0 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 268++CBF1 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 269++CBF4 D1                                   pop     de
 270++CBF5 C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 271++CBF6                      ENDIF
 272++CBF6
 273++CBF6              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 274++CBF6              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 275++CBF6              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 276++CBF6              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 277++CBF6 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 278++CBF7 32 A0 7E                             ld      (varR),a
 279++CBFA CD B4 CC                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 280++CBFD F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 281++CBFE C5                                   push    bc
 282++CBFF 47                                   ld      b,a
 283++CC00 3A BB 7E                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 284++CC03 FE 00                                cp      0
 285++CC05 78                                   ld      a,b
 286++CC06 C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 287++CC07 C2 1E CC                             jp      nz, .LL121
 288++CC0A              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 289++CC0A 3A 24 CA     .LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 290++CC0D 32 9F 7E                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 291++CC10 CD A9 8F                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 292++CC13 22 29 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 293++CC16 F1                                   pop     af
 294++CC17 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 295++CC1A CA 4A CC                             jp      z,.LL133
 296++CC1D C9                                   ret
 297++CC1E 11 FE FF     .LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 298++CC21 2A A0 7E                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 299++CC24 3A 9F 7E                             ld      a,(varQ)
 300++CC27 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 301++CC28              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 301++CC28 CB 25       >			   sla l
 301++CC2A CB 14       >			   rl  h
 302++CC2C 7C                                   ld      a,h
 303++CC2D 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 304++CC2F                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 304++CC2F B8          >                        cp      b
 304++CC30 DA 3B CC    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 305++CC33 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 306++CC34 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 307++CC35 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 308++CC36 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 309++CC37 DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 310++CC39 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 311++CC3A 3F                                   ccf
 312++CC3B              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 312++CC3B CB 13       >               rl  e
 312++CC3D CB 12       >               rl  d
 313++CC3F 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 314++CC41 ED 53 29 CA                          ld      (varYX),de
 315++CC45 F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 316++CC46 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 317++CC49 C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 318++CC4A 2A 29 CA     .LL133:                 ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 319++CC4D                                      NegHL
 319++CC4D AF          >                    xor a
 319++CC4E 95          >                    sub l
 319++CC4F 6F          >                    ld l,a
 319++CC50 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 319++CC51 94          >                    sub h
 319++CC52 67          >                    ld h,a
 320++CC53 22 29 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 321++CC56 C9           .LL128:                 ret
 322++CC57
 323++CC57
 324++CC57
 325++CC57
 326++CC57              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 327++CC57              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 328++CC57              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 329++CC57              ;
 330++CC57              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 331++CC57              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 332++CC57              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 333++CC57 CD B4 CC     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 334++CC5A F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 335++CC5B C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 336++CC5C 47                                   ld      b,a
 337++CC5D 3A BB 7E                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 338++CC60 FE 00                                cp      0
 339++CC62 78                                   ld      a,b
 340++CC63 C1                                   pop     bc
 341++CC64 C2 A0 CC                             jp      nz, .LL122
 342++CC67              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 343++CC67 11 FE FF     .LL121:                 ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 344++CC6A 2A A0 7E                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 345++CC6D 3A 9F 7E                             ld      a,(varQ)
 346++CC70 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 347++CC71              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 347++CC71 CB 25       >			   sla l
 347++CC73 CB 14       >			   rl  h
 348++CC75 7C                                   ld      a,h
 349++CC76 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 350++CC78                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 350++CC78 B8          >                        cp      b
 350++CC79 DA 84 CC    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 351++CC7C 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 352++CC7D 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 353++CC7E 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 354++CC7F 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 355++CC80 DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 356++CC82 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 357++CC83 3F                                   ccf
 358++CC84              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 358++CC84 CB 13       >               rl  e
 358++CC86 CB 12       >               rl  d
 359++CC88 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 360++CC8A ED 53 29 CA                          ld      (varYX),de
 361++CC8E F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 362++CC8F ED 27 80                             test    $80
 363++CC92 C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 364++CC93 2A 29 CA     .LL133:                 ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 365++CC96                                      NegHL
 365++CC96 AF          >                    xor a
 365++CC97 95          >                    sub l
 365++CC98 6F          >                    ld l,a
 365++CC99 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 365++CC9A 94          >                    sub h
 365++CC9B 67          >                    ld h,a
 366++CC9C 22 29 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 367++CC9F C9           .LL128:                 ret
 368++CCA0              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 369++CCA0 3A 24 CA     .LL122:                 ld      a,(clipGradient)
 370++CCA3 32 9F 7E                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 371++CCA6 CD A9 8F                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 372++CCA9 22 29 CA                             ld      (varYX),hl
 373++CCAC F1                                   pop     af
 374++CCAD ED 27 80                             test    $80
 375++CCB0 CA 93 CC                             jp      z,.LL133
 376++CCB3 C9                                   ret
 377++CCB4
 378++CCB4              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 379++CCB4              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 380++CCB4              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 381++CCB4              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 382++CCB4 3A 24 CA     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 383++CCB7 32 9F 7E                             ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = XX12+2
 384++CCBA 3A A1 7E                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 385++CCBD E5 F5                                push    hl,,af                      ; else
 386++CCBF ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;   if bit 7 is clear
 387++CCC2 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127                    ;      RS = ABS RS
 388++CCC4 2A A0 7E                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ;      .
 389++CCC7                                      NegHL                               ;      .
 389++CCC7 AF          >                    xor a
 389++CCC8 95          >                    sub l
 389++CCC9 6F          >                    ld l,a
 389++CCCA 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 389++CCCB 94          >                    sub h
 389++CCCC 67          >                    ld h,a
 390++CCCD 22 A0 7E                             ld      (varRS),hl                  ;      .
 391++CCD0 21 25 CA     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign              ;   hl = dxy sign
 392++CCD3 F1                                   pop     af                          ;
 393++CCD4 AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 394++CCD5 E1                                   pop     hl
 395++CCD6 C9                                   ret
 396++CCD7
 397++CCD7              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 398++CCD7              ; Thow away out of bounds by more than 250
 399++CCD7              ClipLineV3:             ;break
 400++CCD7                      IFDEF       CLIPVersion3
 401++CCD7 ~            ;My logic version
 402++CCD7 ~            .CheckYorder:
 403++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipY1)
 404++CCD7 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipY2)
 405++CCD7 ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn
 406++CCD7 ~                                    jr      c,.LineP1toP2                          ; if Y1 < Y2 then we can use the points as is else we have to swap
 407++CCD7 ~            .LineP2toP1:            ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; fetch and write out in reverse
 408++CCD7 ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY1)
 409++CCD7 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 410++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 411++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY1),bc                      ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
 412++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY2),ix                      ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
 413++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX1),hl                      ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
 414++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX2),de                      ;  de - XX15(4,5) X2
 415++CCD7 ~                                    jp      .CheckNoClip
 416++CCD7 ~            .LineP1toP2             ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
 417++CCD7 ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
 418++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)                      ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
 419++CCD7 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)                      ; de - XX15(4,5) X2
 420++CCD7 ~            .CheckNoClip:           ld      a,b
 421++CCD7 ~                                    or      d
 422++CCD7 ~                                    or      h
 423++CCD7 ~                                    or      ixh
 424++CCD7 ~                                    jp      nz,.CheckXOffScreen                 ; if both Y1 and y2 have bit 7 set
 425++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,c                                 ; then we clip
 426++CCD7 ~                                    and     ixl
 427++CCD7 ~                                    test    $80
 428++CCD7 ~                                    jp      z, .ClipComplete
 429++CCD7 ~            ;if either x1hi x2hi are 0 then we clip. if both <> 0and both same sign exit
 430++CCD7 ~            .CheckXOffScreen:       ld      a,h
 431++CCD7 ~                                    xor     d
 432++CCD7 ~                                    test    $80                                 ; non descructive test of bit 7 is set
 433++CCD7 ~                                    jp      nz,.X1X2OppositeSign                ; if bit 7 was set then x1 and x2 must be opposite signs so its on screen
 434++CCD7 ~            .X1X2SameSigns:         ld      a,h                                 ; so to get there h and d must be the same sign
 435++CCD7 ~                                    test    $80                                 ; if they are the same sign and at x1 is negative then x2 must be negative so off screen
 436++CCD7 ~                                    JumpIfAIsZero .X1X2CheckIfBothRight
 437++CCD7 ~            .X1X2BothNegative:      SetCarryFlag                                ; to get to here x1 and x2 must be high and off the same sign so its not to draw
 438++CCD7 ~                                    ret
 439++CCD7 ~            .X1X2CheckIfBothRight:  and     a                                   ; we have h in a already
 440++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.X1OnScreen
 441++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,d
 442++CCD7 ~                                    and     a
 443++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.X2OnScreen
 444++CCD7 ~            .X1X2OffRightSide:      SetCarryFlag                                ; to get to here x1 and x2 must be high and off the same sign so its not to draw
 445++CCD7 ~                                    ret
 446++CCD7 ~            ;                       to get to here x1 and x2 either span -ve to +ve or from on screen to off screen
 447++CCD7 ~            .X1OnScreen:
 448++CCD7 ~            .X2OnScreen:
 449++CCD7 ~            .X1X2OppositeSign:
 450++CCD7 ~            ;                       Now check to see if Y is off screen
 451++CCD7 ~            .CheckYOffScreen:       ld      a,b                                     ; Check if y1 and y2 are opposite signs, fi so it spans screen so we are good
 452++CCD7 ~            .CheckBothYNegative:    xor     ixh
 453++CCD7 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; if bit 7 is set then opposite signs
 454++CCD7 ~                                    jp      nz,.Y1Y2OppositeSign                    ; if y1 and y2 are opposite signs its on screen and spans at least one side
 455++CCD7 ~            .Y1Y2SameSign:          ld      a,b                                     ; if they are the same sign then if one is negative, so is the other so off screen
 456++CCD7 ~                                    test    $80
 457++CCD7 ~                                    jp      z,.Y1Y2Positive
 458++CCD7 ~            .Y1Y2Negative:          SetCarryFlag
 459++CCD7 ~                                    ret
 460++CCD7 ~            .Y1Y2Positive:          ld      a,c                                     ; if its the same sign y1 or y2 could be 0 and if they are
 461++CCD7 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; this will test to see if b >0 or c > 127
 462++CCD7 ~                                    or      b                                       ;
 463++CCD7 ~                                    jp      z,.Y1OnScreen
 464++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,ixl
 465++CCD7 ~                                    and     $80
 466++CCD7 ~                                    or      ixh
 467++CCD7 ~                                    jp      z,.Y2OnScreen
 468++CCD7 ~            .Y1Y2OffBottomSide:     SetCarryFlag
 469++CCD7 ~                                    ret
 470++CCD7 ~            .Y1OnScreen:
 471++CCD7 ~            .Y2OnScreen:
 472++CCD7 ~            .Y1Y2OppositeSign:
 473++CCD7 ~            .StartProcessing:       ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)                      ; Now we can test and Clip
 474++CCD7 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)                      ; de - XX15(4,5)
 475++CCD7 ~                                    ld      iyh,0                                   ; set iyh flags to 0
 476++CCD7 ~            ; if x1hi or y1 high <> 0 or y1 > 127 then set bit 1 of clipcoord       ; we can optimise this later
 477++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,h
 478++CCD7 ~                                    or      b
 479++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP1Ylo
 480++CCD7 ~            ;                       iyh     bit 0 - P1 Needs Clipping
 481++CCD7 ~            ;                               bit 1 - P2 Needs Clipping
 482++CCD7 ~            ;                               bit 2 - x1 >= x2 (left to right)
 483++CCD7 ~            ;                               bit 3 - y1 >= y2 (top to bottom)
 484++CCD7 ~            ;                               bit 4 -  DY/DX (steep)
 485++CCD7 ~            .P1OffScreen:           ld      iyh,1                                   ; if either p1 x or y was off screen set bit 0 to 1
 486++CCD7 ~                                    jp      .CheckP2OffScreen                       ; .
 487++CCD7 ~            .CheckP1Ylo:            ld      a,c                                     ; .
 488++CCD7 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; .
 489++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP2OffScreen                     ; .
 490++CCD7 ~                                    ld      iyh,1                                   ; .
 491++CCD7 ~            .CheckP2OffScreen:      ld      a,d                                     ; if x2hi or y2 off screen then set bit 2 of clipcoord to 1
 492++CCD7 ~                                    or      ixh                                     ; .
 493++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP2Ylo                           ; .
 494++CCD7 ~            .P2OffScreen:           ld      a,iyh                                   ; .
 495++CCD7 ~                                    or      2                                       ; .
 496++CCD7 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 497++CCD7 ~                                    jp      .CheckXDirection                        ; .
 498++CCD7 ~            .CheckP2Ylo:            ld      a,ixl                                   ; .
 499++CCD7 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; .
 500++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckXDirection                      ; .
 501++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,iyh                                   ; .
 502++CCD7 ~                                    or      2                                       ; .
 503++CCD7 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 504++CCD7 ~            .CheckXDirection:       push    de,,hl
 505++CCD7 ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn                          ; IF HL equals DE, Z=1,C=0, IF HL is less than DE, Z=0,C=1, IF HL is more than DE, Z=0,C=0
 506++CCD7 ~                                    pop     de,,hl
 507++CCD7 ~                                    jp      c,.CalculateDx                          ;
 508++CCD7 ~            .X1gteX2:               ld      a,iyh                                   ; if x1 >= x2 then set bit 3 to denote -ve x direction, note we will eliminate horziontal / vertical early as an optimisation
 509++CCD7 ~                                    or      4                                       ; .
 510++CCD7 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 511++CCD7 ~                                    ; Y Direction is now always top to bottom
 512++CCD7 ~            .CalculateDx:           ClearCarryFlag                                  ;                       calculate DX
 513++CCD7 ~                                    sbc     hl,de                                   ; .
 514++CCD7 ~            .ABSDX:                 ld      a,h                                     ; HL = | HL - DE |
 515++CCD7 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; .
 516++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.DXPositive                           ; .
 517++CCD7 ~                                    macronegate16hl                                 ; .
 518++CCD7 ~            .DXPositive:            ex      de,hl                                   ; de = abs delta x
 519++CCD7 ~            .CalculateDy:           ClearCarryFlag                                  ; hl = Y2 -Y1 as its pre sorted its always positive if on screen
 520++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,ix                                   ; iy = hl = Y2 - Y1
 521++CCD7 ~                                    sbc     hl,bc                                   ; .
 522++CCD7 ~            .DYPositive:            ; Scale DX and DY to 8 bit, by here hl = abs dy, de = abs dx
 523++CCD7 ~            ;calculate DY
 524++CCD7 ~            .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                                     ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 525++CCD7 ~                                    or      d                                       ; .
 526++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.ScaleDone                            ; .
 527++CCD7 ~                                    ShiftDERight1                                   ; .
 528++CCD7 ~                                    ShiftHLRight1                                   ; .
 529++CCD7 ~                                    jr      .ScaleLoop                              ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been;;                                                                                               negative
 530++CCD7 ~            .ScaleDone:             ; hl = ABS DY, DE = ABS DX,  bc = Y1, ix = Y2,   note H and D will be zero
 531++CCD7 ~            ; if Dx = 0 then horizontal line and clip X1 & X2 only then exit
 532++CCD7 ~            ; if Dy = 0 then vertical line and clip Y1 & Y2 only then exit
 533++CCD7 ~
 534++CCD7 ~            ; if DX < DY  gradient = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 535++CCD7 ~            ;        else gradient = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo, set bit 5 of clipcord
 536++CCD7 ~            .CalculateDelta:        ld      a,e                                     ; if DX < DY goto DX/DY
 537++CCD7 ~                                    JumpIfALTNusng l,.DXdivDY                       ; else do DY/DX
 538++CCD7 ~            .DYdivDX:               ld      a,l                                     ;    A = DY
 539++CCD7 ~                                    ld      d,e                                     ;    D = DX
 540++CCD7 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD                         ;    A = R = 256 * DY / DX
 541++CCD7 ~            .SaveGradientDYDX:      ld      (Gradient),a
 542++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,iyh                                   ;    bit 5 of iyh denotes that its a DX/DY (steep), if its clear its DY/DX (shallow)
 543++CCD7 ~                                    or      16                                      ;    .
 544++CCD7 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ;    .
 545++CCD7 ~                                    jp      .ClipP1                                 ;    .
 546++CCD7 ~            .DXdivDY:               ld      a,e                                     ;    A = DX
 547++CCD7 ~                                    ld      d,l                                     ;    D = DY
 548++CCD7 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD                         ;    A = R = 256 * DX / DY
 549++CCD7 ~            .SaveGradientDXDY:      ld      (Gradient),a
 550++CCD7 ~            ; if bit 1 of clipccord is set call    LL118
 551++CCD7 ~            .ClipP1:                ld      a,iyh                                   ; if bit 1 is clear to say no need to clip pont 1 we just jump to point 2
 552++CCD7 ~                                    test    1                                       ; .
 553++CCD7 ~                                    jp      z,.ClipP2                               ; .
 554++CCD7 ~                                    call    LL118v3                                 ; else clip P1 first
 555++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,b                                     ;      and if b or h have a value its failed to totally clip  as it may be only in bounds on just x or y
 556++CCD7 ~                                    or      h                                       ;      .
 557++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z, .P1Ygt127Check                       ;      .
 558++CCD7 ~            .P1HighOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                                    ;      .
 559++CCD7 ~                                    ret                                             ;      .
 560++CCD7 ~            .P1Ygt127Check:         ld      a,c                                     ;      or if y > 127 its failed to totally clip
 561++CCD7 ~                                    test    $80                                     ;      .
 562++CCD7 ~                                    SetCarryFlag                                    ;      .
 563++CCD7 ~                                    ret     nz                                      ;      .
 564++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY1), bc                     ;      else its valid and clipped point 1 so save ti back
 565++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX1), hl
 566++CCD7 ~            ; if bit 2 of clipcoord is set
 567++CCD7 ~            ;        swap x1y1 with x2y2
 568++CCD7 ~            ;        call    LL118
 569++CCD7 ~            .ClipP2:                ld      a,iyh                                   ; so now repeat all that for point 2
 570++CCD7 ~                                    and     2
 571++CCD7 ~                                    jp      z,.ClipComplete
 572++CCD7 ~                                    call    LL118v3PreSwap                          ; now clip p2
 573++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,b                                     ; if either high is set then it failed to properly clip
 574++CCD7 ~                                    or      h                                       ; .
 575++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z, .P2Ygt127Check                       ; .
 576++CCD7 ~            .P2HighOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                                    ; .
 577++CCD7 ~                                    ret                                             ; .
 578++CCD7 ~            .P2Ygt127Check:         ld      a,c                                     ; if c > 127 then it also failed to clip
 579++CCD7 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; .
 580++CCD7 ~                                    SetCarryFlag                                    ; .
 581++CCD7 ~                                    ret     nz                                      ; .
 582++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY2), bc                     ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 583++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX2), hl
 584++CCD7 ~            ;clip compelte exit
 585++CCD7 ~            .ClipComplete:          ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 586++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 587++CCD7 ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 588++CCD7 ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 589++CCD7 ~            .SaveClippedLine:       ld      a,c                                     ; Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
 590++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
 591++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,ixl
 592++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
 593++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,l
 594++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
 595++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,e
 596++CCD7 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
 597++CCD7 ~                                    ClearCarryFlag                              ; we have a success so not carry
 598++CCD7 ~                                    ret
 599++CCD7 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 600++CCD7 ~            LL118v3PreSwap:         ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY2)                  ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 601++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 602++CCD7 ~                                    jp      LL118v3Fetched
 603++CCD7 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 604++CCD7 ~            LL118v3:                ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                  ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 605++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 606++CCD7 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 607++CCD7 ~            LL118v3Fetched:
 608++CCD7 ~            ;                       At this point bc = y position, hl = x position both 16 bit
 609++CCD7 ~            ;                       if x < 0 then x = 0
 610++CCD7 ~            ;                                     adjust = -x */ gradient depending on if its steep or shallow
 611++CCD7 ~            ;                                     y = y +- adjust depending on if we are going +ve direction or negative direction  (or simplify it, that it will always be + for x1y1 and - for x2y2 as we pre-sort)
 612++CCD7 ~            ;                       if x > 255 then x = 255
 613++CCD7 ~            ;                                     adjust = x-255 */ gradient
 614++CCD7 ~            ;                                     y = y +- adjust depending on if we are going +ve direction or negative direction  (or simplify it, that it will always be + for x1y1 and - for x2y2 as we pre-sort)
 615++CCD7 ~            ;                       if y < 0 then y = 0
 616++CCD7 ~            ;                                     adjust = -y */ gradient
 617++CCD7 ~            ;                                     x = x +- adjust depending on if we are going left to right or visa versa
 618++CCD7 ~            ;                       if y >127 then y = 127
 619++CCD7 ~            ;                                     adjust = y-127 */ gradient
 620++CCD7 ~            ;                                     x = x +- adjust depending on if we are going left to right or visa versa
 621++CCD7 ~            ;
 622++CCD7 ~            ;                       iyh     bit 0 - P1 Needs Clipping
 623++CCD7 ~            ;                               bit 1 - P2 Needs Clipping
 624++CCD7 ~            ;                               bit 2 - x1 >= x2 (left to right)
 625++CCD7 ~            ;                               bit 3 - y1 >= y2 (top to bottom)
 626++CCD7 ~            ;                               bit 4 -  DY/DX (steep)
 627++CCD7 ~            ; if X1 hi <> 0
 628++CCD7 ~            LL118:                  ;break
 629++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,h                                     ; if x1 high is 0 then we don't need to clip x at all
 630++CCD7 ~                                    and     a
 631++CCD7 ~                                    jp      z,.X1NoClipNeeded
 632++CCD7 ~            ;                       if x1 hi bit 7 is set (so negative)
 633++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockX:            test    $80                                     ; if h is postiive then jump to the XPositive Calc block
 634++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockXPositive
 635++CCD7 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = abs(X1) / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 636++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockXNegative:    ld      a,iyh                                   ;
 637++CCD7 ~                                    test    16                                      ; bit 5 of iyh denotes that its a DY/DX, if its clear its DX/DY
 638++CCD7 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockXNegMulGrad
 639++CCD7 ~            .CaclBlockXNegDivGrad:  macronegate16hl
 640++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 641++CCD7 ~                                    push    bc                                      ; abs(X1) / Gradient
 642++CCD7 ~                                    ld      h,c                     ; move offset into high byte of h
 643++CCD7 ~                                    ld      l,0
 644++CCD7 ~                                    ld      c,a
 645++CCD7 ~                                    call    div_hl_c
 646++CCD7 ~                                    pop     bc
 647++CCD7 ~                                    jp      .DoneXNegCalc
 648++CCD7 ~            ;                       else set Adjust = abs(X1) * Gradient
 649++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockXNegMulGrad:  push    bc                                      ; abs(X1) * Gradient
 650++CCD7 ~                                    macronegate16hl
 651++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 652++CCD7 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256
 653++CCD7 ~                                    pop     bc
 654++CCD7 ~            ;                       y1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 4 of clipcoord is set)
 655++CCD7 ~            ;                       x1 = 0 then call into DonrX1Calc
 656++CCD7 ~            ;                       we can skip the test for negative Y direection
 657++CCD7 ~            .DoneXNegCalc:          macronegate16hl
 658++CCD7 ~            .XNegSkipNegate:        ld      de,bc
 659++CCD7 ~                                    ex      hl,de
 660++CCD7 ~                                    add     hl,de
 661++CCD7 ~                                    ld      bc,hl
 662++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,0
 663++CCD7 ~                                    jp      .DoneXCalc
 664++CCD7 ~            ;                       else x1 hi is positive
 665++CCD7 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = X1 lo / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 666++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockXPositive:    ld      a,iyh
 667++CCD7 ~                                    test    16
 668++CCD7 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockXPosMulGrad
 669++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockXPosDivGrad:  ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 670++CCD7 ~                                    push    bc
 671++CCD7 ~                                    ld      c,a
 672++CCD7 ~                                    ld      de,255
 673++CCD7 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 674++CCD7 ~                                    ld      h,l
 675++CCD7 ~                                    ld      l,0
 676++CCD7 ~                                    call    div_hl_c
 677++CCD7 ~                                    pop     bc
 678++CCD7 ~                                    jp      .DoneX2Calc
 679++CCD7 ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = X1 lo * Gradient
 680++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockXPosMulGrad:  push    bc
 681++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 682++CCD7 ~                                    ld      de,255
 683++CCD7 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 684++CCD7 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
 685++CCD7 ~                                    pop     bc
 686++CCD7 ~            ;                       y1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 4 of clipcoord is set)
 687++CCD7 ~            ;                       x1 = 255
 688++CCD7 ~            ;                       we can skip the test for negative Y direection
 689++CCD7 ~            .DoneX2Calc:            macronegate16hl
 690++CCD7 ~            .X2SkipNegate:          ex      de,hl
 691++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 692++CCD7 ~                                    add     hl,de
 693++CCD7 ~                                    ld      bc,hl
 694++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,255
 695++CCD7 ~            ;                       if Y1 hi <> 0 or Y1 low >= 128 then y coordinate is good
 696++CCD7 ~            .DoneXCalc:             ld      a,b
 697++CCD7 ~                                    and     a
 698++CCD7 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockY1Test
 699++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,c
 700++CCD7 ~                                    and     $80
 701++CCD7 ~                                    ClearCarryFlag                  ; speculative clear of carry in case its good
 702++CCD7 ~                                    ret     z
 703++CCD7 ~            ;                       if Y1 hi bit 7 is set
 704++CCD7 ~            .X1NoClipNeeded:
 705++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockY1Test:       ld      a,b
 706++CCD7 ~                                    test    $80
 707++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockYPos       ; if Y is positive jump forward
 708++CCD7 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = abs(Y1) / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 709++CCD7 ~                                    break
 710++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockY1:           ld      a,iyh
 711++CCD7 ~                                    test    16
 712++CCD7 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockYNegMulGrad
 713++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockYNegDivGrad:  macronegate16bc
 714++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 715++CCD7 ~                                    push    hl
 716++CCD7 ~                                    ld      h,c                     ; move offset into high byte of h
 717++CCD7 ~                                    ld      l,0
 718++CCD7 ~                                    ld      c,a
 719++CCD7 ~                                    call    div_hl_c;LLHLdivC;div_hl_c
 720++CCD7 ~                                    pop     de
 721++CCD7 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 722++CCD7 ~                                    jp      .DoneBlockY1
 723++CCD7 ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = abs(Y1) * Gradient
 724++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockYNegMulGrad:  macronegate16bc
 725++CCD7 ~                                    push    hl
 726++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 727++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 728++CCD7 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
 729++CCD7 ~                                    pop     de
 730++CCD7 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 731++CCD7 ~            ;                       x1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 3 of clipcoord is set)
 732++CCD7 ~            ;                       y1 = 0
 733++CCD7 ~            ;                       ret
 734++CCD7 ~            ;                       now we have done the adjustment, if y or x are off screen then the line spans screen in only 1 dimension so doesn't get drawn
 735++CCD7 ~            .DoneBlockY1:           ld      a,iyh
 736++CCD7 ~                                    test    4
 737++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.Y1SkipNegate
 738++CCD7 ~                                    macronegate16de
 739++CCD7 ~            .Y1SkipNegate:          add     hl,de
 740++CCD7 ~                                    ld      bc,0
 741++CCD7 ~                                    ret
 742++CCD7 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = Y1 lo / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 743++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockYPos:         ld      a,iyh
 744++CCD7 ~                                    test    16
 745++CCD7 ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockYPosMulGrad
 746++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockYPosDivGrad:  ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 747++CCD7 ~                                    push    hl
 748++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 749++CCD7 ~                                    ld      de,127
 750++CCD7 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 751++CCD7 ~                                    ld      h,l
 752++CCD7 ~                                    ld      l,0
 753++CCD7 ~                                    ld      c,a
 754++CCD7 ~                                    call    div_hl_c;LLHLdivC
 755++CCD7 ~                                    pop     de
 756++CCD7 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 757++CCD7 ~                                    jp      .DoneBlockY2
 758++CCD7 ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = Y1 lo * Gradient
 759++CCD7 ~            .CalcBlockYPosMulGrad:  push    hl
 760++CCD7 ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 761++CCD7 ~                                    ld      de,127
 762++CCD7 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 763++CCD7 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 764++CCD7 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
 765++CCD7 ~                                    pop     de
 766++CCD7 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 767++CCD7 ~            ;                x1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 3 of clipcoord is set)
 768++CCD7 ~            ;                y1 = 127
 769++CCD7 ~            .DoneBlockY2:           ld      a,iyh
 770++CCD7 ~                                    test    4
 771++CCD7 ~                                    jr      nz,.Y2SkipNegate
 772++CCD7 ~                                    macronegate16de
 773++CCD7 ~            .Y2SkipNegate:          add     hl,de
 774++CCD7 ~                                    ld      bc,127
 775++CCD7 ~                                    ret
 776++CCD7                      ELSE
 777++CCD7 C9                       ret
 778++CCD8                      ENDIF
 779++CCD8              ; old code for on screen test
 780++CCD8              ;;;;;;; if y1 > 127 and y2 > 127 then same sing and exit
 781++CCD8              ;;;;;;
 782++CCD8              ;;;;;;;if y1hi y2hi are <> 0 and both same sign exit
 783++CCD8              ;;;;;;.CheckYOffScreen:       ld      a,b                                 ; y1 and y2 high tests
 784++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        and     ixh
 785++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        jp      .CheckYLow
 786++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        ld
 787++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        and     a                                   ; if either is zero then we can check for > 127
 788++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        jr      z,.YHighNegativeCheck               ;
 789++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,ixh                               ;
 790++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        and     a                                   ;
 791++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        ret     nz                                  ;
 792++CCD8              ;;;;;;;if y1h bit 7 and y2h bit 7 set then exit as both -ve
 793++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,b                                 ;
 794++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        and     ixh                                 ;
 795++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        and     $80                                 ;
 796++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        ret     z                                   ;
 797++CCD8              ;;;;;;;if y1h > 0 and y2h > 0 then exit as both are +ve high
 798++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,b                                 ;
 799++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        and     ixh                                 ;
 800++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        ret     nz                                  ;
 801++CCD8              ;;;;;;;if y1h or y2h is not 0 then proceed to clip
 802++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,b
 803++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        or      ixh
 804++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        jr      nz,.StartProcessing
 805++CCD8              ;;;;;;;if (y1l bit 7 is set and y1h is clear ) or (y2l bit 7 is set and y2h is clear) the proceed to clip
 806++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,c
 807++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        or      ixl
 808++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        and     $80
 809++CCD8              ;;;;;;                        jr      z,.StartProcessing
 810++CCD8              ;;;;;;
 811++CCD8              ;;;;;;.CheckYOffScreen:       ld      a,b                                 ;
